float QuantMethodGTypeCHPReport::medianOfPmProbes ( ProbeSetGroup &  psGroup,
const IntensityMart &  iMart,
int  chipIx 
)

For genotyping CHP files GTYPE likes to have the median of the raw intensity probes stuffed into the confidence field of the CHP files.

I'm not sure why but Richard C asked for it so here it is.

Parameters:
psGroup - Groupt of probes.
iMart - Raw intensity data for chips.
chipIx - Which chip we are taking the median for.
Returns:
median of all raw intensities for the PM probes in psGroup.

QuantMethod &  qMethod,
const IntensityMart &  iMart,
std::vector< ChipStream * > &  iTrans,
PmAdjuster &  pmAdjust 
) [virtual]

After every probeset computation this function is called an is an opportunity to query the quantification method for results, residuals, etc.

Parameters:
psGroup - List of probesets from which probes were used.
qMethod - Quantification method with compute method called.

bool QuantMethodGTypeCHPReport::reportFailure ( ProbeSetGroup &  psGroup,
QuantMethod &  qMethod,
const IntensityMart &  iMart,
std::vector< ChipStream * > &  iTrans,
PmAdjuster &  pmAdjust 
) [virtual]

If a probeset fails to compute for whatever reason then this method is called rather than the normal report call above.

By default does nothing.

Parameters:
psGroup - List of probesets from which probes were used.
qMethod - Quantification method with compute method called.
Returns:
true if success, false otherwise.

Reimplemented from QuantMethodReport.

void QuantMethodGTypeCHPReport::setChpFileNames ( std::vector< std::string > &  fileNames  )  [inline]

Set the CHP filenames to use for output.

This overrides any prefix and allows the caller to place the chp files anyplace they are desired.

Parameters:
fileNames - Vector of fileNames with full path to output file, one for each cel file.
